intro: Fockea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fockea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and striking tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, are pollinated by birds and insects. Fockea angustifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
